values.description:
They.Create are a design and development studio based in Brighton and founded in 2006. 

Our office in the North Laines is packed to the rafters with brilliance and ingenuity. 

Our work is award winning and our working culture simple; we love what we do.

values.description:
Gresham Blake is an innovative contemporary designer tailor, specialising in bespoke and made to measure suits for men and women. His relaxed approach makes a welcome alternative to Saville Row, providing the same consistently high level of personal service, professionalism, quality and attention to detail combined with his unique skill and creative flair.

With stores in Brighton and a showroom in London’s Mayfair, we provide clients with guidance on all aspects of the made to measure and bespoke process, via our professional team of dedicated consultants and stylists. If you have a specific enquiry, or would like to book an appointment with us please call our customer service line on 01273 622 531

You can also use our website to buy directly, view previous collections, look through the company portfolio, keep up with all our latest news and sign up to our mailing list to receive information about special offers, promotions and customer events.
values.name: Gresham Blake Ltd

values.description:
Welcome to LAHRA, the Livingston Area Human Resources Association.


LAHRA was established in 2006 by a small group of Livingston County HR professionals who were looking for local networking and support.  Within six months of the first program meeting, LAHRA met the requirements for affiliation with the Society of Human Resource Management, and became its 708th chapter.  In early 2007, the chapter was designated a Superior Merit Chapter by SHRM for accomplishments during its first calendar year of existence, a distinguished honor. 


LAHRA prides itself on offering quality speakers at its monthly program meetings, with an emphasis on topics which are approved for HRCI recertification credits.  In addition, the organization looks for opportunities to contribute to the community through related volunteer efforts, and supports the national organization through fundraising for the SHRM Foundation.  LAHRA is closely linked with its sister chapters in Detroit, Lansing and Ann Arbor, and occasionally sponsors joint meetings or events with these chapters. 


LAHRA welcomes members and non-members to attend its monthly program meetings and other events.  We encourage interested professionals to submit a membership application, and to become actively involved in the organization as a volunteer.  For more information, please explore our website or contact us at info@livingstonhr.org.

values: HR Networking for brighton / Howell Area

values.name: Livingston Area Human Resources Association

values.description: Red Funnel is the original Isle of Wight ferry company with a history spanning over 150 years in its present form but with roots stretching back as far as the 1820's. Much has changed since Red Funnel's paddle steamers ran excursions from Southampton as far as Brighton, Cherbourg and Torquay but we are still just as passionate about delivering great customer service and providing value for money.
values.name: Red Funnel Group

values.description:
Wikipedia defines a Gastropub as “a British term for a Public House which specializes in high quality food a step above the more basic pub grub." The name is a portmanteau (combination) of “pub” (the short form of public house) and “gastro” (short for gastronomy, or food-related). It was first used in 1991 when David Eyre and Michael Belbon opened a pub in Clerkenwell, London named The Eagle, that placed an emphasis on food quality not common in existing British pubs. In its simplest form, a Gastro Pub is “a place with a warm, inviting pub atmosphere that serves sophisticated, yet unpretentious food.” An extensive, and creative, Beer and Wine List is an integral part of the concept. 

Why Victoria? 

Many of the pubs in London are located in close proximity to “Tube” stops on the Metro System. The name Victoria is derived from Victoria Station, a stop that connects the Brighton and Chatham Main Lines on that system. It is also the name of the pub's Chief Experience Officer and daughter of our Proprietors. 

What is Our Menu like? 

The main objective of our kitchen is to serve innovative twists on classic pub fare that stress quality and freshness with every recipe, and every ingredient. The menu items will draw from both national and international cooking traditions and will remain in harmony with the seasonal availability of high-quality ingredients.

values: MONDAY NIGHT: Beer club night in pub 5:00-2:00am
ALL DAY TUESDAY: ½ Price House Martinis
ALL DAY THURSDAY: ½ Price Wine Bottles

values.name: Victoria Gastro Pub

values.description:

values.description:
Established in 1994, Wildwood PR is a growing agency based in Horsham, West Sussex.
	
The agency specialises in the eco building, interiors, home technology and event sectors. Wildwood PR is clearly focussed on generating results for its clients with successful, pro-active business to business and business to consumer campaigns. 

The company’s current portfolio of clients in building services includes international lighting company Havells Sylvania, CEDIA, The British Institute of Interior Design, the Brighton Centre, Panasonic heating and cooling, Crestron, and many more.

values.description: A shopping portal dedicated to promoting the work of Britain’s most talented independent designers and craftspeople – Brighton POD is the fast, simple and ethical alternative to shopping in our franchise-choked high streets. When you purchase a product from POD using the secure checkout, you are buying directly from the designer or craftsperson. This enables them to price their goods fairly and competitively, because they keep 80% of the retail price.
values.name: BrightonPOD

values.description:
What is it? 
A professionally staffed nursery for up to 15 children on
the ground floor and above, on the top floor, a co-working space with
internet, printer, scanner, fax, private meeting rooms and IT support.

Where is it? 
In central Brighton, just five minutes walk from the station.
Three floors of large and light rooms; roll your buggy into the ground
floor nursery which has a secure and fun garden out the back. The two
floors above are for both work and networking - enough space to have a
private phone call/meeting or chat over a coffee and your laptop.

How does it work? 
Monthly membership with 8 hours of childcare/
co-working per week. These hours can be rolled on for a quarter of a
year. Hours should be booked online by midday Friday of the
preceding week. If the membership allowance has been used up,
more can be purchased at an hourly rate.

Who is it for? Any parent with a child under 5 years of age: freelance
parents with unpredictable working hours; mothers who want a few
hours to themselves in the first few months after their child’s birth,
before they think about going back to a fulltime job; mature student
parents with timetables that change from term to term.

Benefits? A community of like-minded families; a chance for a
mother to ease herself back into work without stopping breastfeeding,
for a father to give the mother of his child a rest while still getting a
chunk of work done; no more paying for nursery care when you don’t
need it.
values.name: Officrèche
Krysalis Photography

values.description:
A Digital Web Design Agency that specialises in web design, branding, illustration, infographics, and web development. We are based in the big city of Brighton & Hove with an office just off Palmeira Square that is one step away from the seaside. We have recently started an intern programme that has resulted in two post graduates being employed part time.

We cater for many clients around the world and enjoy a challenge. We have recently been over to Miami to help run a four day event for one of our biggest clients, so as well as designing all the websites and printed media we helped run the social media too.

We have two developers working for Logo Logo, Chris Leggett and John Dillion. One a PHP dev and the other a .Net specialist. We are able to handle responsive, e-commerce or javascript motion graphics. As well as all the normal web jobs you would expect.

values.description: The official Tourism Organization for Bay of Quinte including Belleville and Quinte West, Deseronto, Tyendinaga. Partnered with Prince Edward County, Brighton and Napanee.  Bay of Quinte Tourism included voting members from The Chambers of Commerce from each area as well as municipal representation.  Non-voting members include over 120 member stakeholders who are listed on the main website www.bayofquintecountry.com.  Partnerships for Regional support of the Bay of Quinte Brand include the Quinte Economic Development Commission which can be seen in the portal:  www.bayofquinte.ca  .

values.description:

Our team of highly-experienced professionals is dedicated to ensuring that your promotional and marketing materials boost your sales and increase your profits.
Our prices are highly competitive, giving you great value for money.

Based in Uckfield, and we provide a service across East and West Sussex and the Kent and Surrey borders, including: Crowborough, East Grinstead, Hailsham, Haywards Heath, Heathfield, Lewes, Brighton, Eastbourne, Oxted, Gatwick and Tunbridge Wells. Our customer base reaches into London and The City.

We are always pleased to talk to you about your print and design projects and to provide prices and advice.

values.description:
Beginning his career at the age of 16, Keith started his own gardening business: Good and Economical during the summer break following his GCSEs. Keith continued to run his business while completing his A Levels and then went on to read Biological Sciences at Brighton University.

Shortly after graduating he joined his first sales team gaining some of his biggest insights into business development, and while there won ‘European Account Manager of the Year 2002’ and ‘Most New UK Logos 2002’ awards. Keith continued to build and deliver his sales and marketing skills working directly as a business development manager and then ultimately delivering his services on a consultancy basis helping business owners create, build and realise value.

Keith is also a keen runner; running for pain, pleasure and charity.  Since completing his first organised run in 2007, Keith has strived to complete at least one major personal challenge a year, from physical tests such as cycling the South Downs Way and running 2 marathons in 8 days to personal development such as volunteering for Young Enterprise and Chair for a property management company.

Keith is currently taking time out from his usual work to pursue dreams and ideas. His full time job is as a stay-at-home-dad during which time Keith has been uniting SAHDs (stay-at-home-dads) in Worthing by co founding Worthing Dads.
values.name: Keith Fowler
